00056 #define LETIMER_COMP_REG_VALID(reg)    (((reg) <= 1))
00057 
00059 #define LETIMER_REF_VALID(ref)         ((ref) == LETIMER0)
00060 
00062 #define LETIMER_REP_REG_VALID(reg)     (((reg) <= 1))

00073 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00074 /***************************************************************************/
00090 __STATIC_INLINE void regSync(LETIMER_TypeDef *letimer, uint32_t mask)
00091 {
00092 #if defined(_LETIMER_FREEZE_MASK)
00093   /* Avoid deadlock if modifying the same register twice when freeze mode is */
00094   /* activated. */
00095   if (letimer->FREEZE & LETIMER_FREEZE_REGFREEZE)
00096     return;
00097 #endif
00098 
00099   /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to have been completed */
00100   /* in low frequency domain, only required for Gecko Family of devices  */
00101   while (letimer->SYNCBUSY & mask)
00102     ;
00103 }
00104 #endif
00105

00109  **************************   GLOBAL FUNCTIONS   *******************************
00110  ******************************************************************************/
00111 
00112 /***************************************************************************/
00125 uint32_t LETIMER_CompareGet(LETIMER_TypeDef *letimer, unsigned int comp)
00126 {
00127   uint32_t ret;
00128 
00129   EFM_ASSERT(LETIMER_REF_VALID(letimer) && LETIMER_COMP_REG_VALID(comp));
00130 
00131   /* Initialize selected compare value */
00132   switch (comp)
00133   {
00134     case 0:
00135       ret = letimer->COMP0;
00136       break;
00137 
00138     case 1:
00139       ret = letimer->COMP1;
00140       break;
00141 
00142     default:
00143       /* Unknown compare register selected */
00144       ret = 0;
00145       break;
00146   }
00147 
00148   return(ret);
00149 }

00152 /***************************************************************************/
00172 void LETIMER_CompareSet(LETIMER_TypeDef *letimer,
00173                         unsigned int comp,
00174                         uint32_t value)
00175 {
00176   volatile uint32_t *compReg;
00177 
00178   EFM_ASSERT(LETIMER_REF_VALID(letimer)
00179              && LETIMER_COMP_REG_VALID(comp)
00180              && ((value & ~(_LETIMER_COMP0_COMP0_MASK
00181                             >> _LETIMER_COMP0_COMP0_SHIFT))
00182                  == 0));
00183 
00184   /* Initialize selected compare value */
00185   switch (comp)
00186   {
00187     case 0:
00188       compReg  = &(letimer->COMP0);
00189       break;
00190 
00191     case 1:
00192       compReg  = &(letimer->COMP1);
00193       break;
00194 
00195     default:
00196       /* Unknown compare register selected, abort */
00197       return;
00198   }
00199 
00200 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00201   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00202   regSync(letimer, comp ? LETIMER_SYNCBUSY_COMP1 : LETIMER_SYNCBUSY_COMP0);
00203 #endif
00204 
00205   *compReg = value;
00206 }

00209 /***************************************************************************/
00227 void LETIMER_Enable(LETIMER_TypeDef *letimer, bool enable)
00228 {
00229   EFM_ASSERT(LETIMER_REF_VALID(letimer));
00230 
00231 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00232   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00233   regSync(letimer, LETIMER_SYNCBUSY_CMD);
00234 #endif
00235 
00236   if (enable)
00237   {
00238     letimer->CMD = LETIMER_CMD_START;
00239   }
00240   else
00241   {
00242     letimer->CMD = LETIMER_CMD_STOP;
00243   }
00244 }
00245 
00246 #if defined(_LETIMER_FREEZE_MASK)
00247 /***************************************************************************/
00274 void LETIMER_FreezeEnable(LETIMER_TypeDef *letimer, bool enable)
00275 {
00276   if (enable)
00277   {
00278     /*
00279      * Wait for any ongoing LF synchronization to complete. This is just to
00280      * protect against the rare case when a user
00281      * - modifies a register requiring LF sync
00282      * - then enables freeze before LF sync completed
00283      * - then modifies the same register again
00284      * since modifying a register while it is in sync progress should be
00285      * avoided.
00286      */
00287     while (letimer->SYNCBUSY)
00288       ;
00289 
00290     letimer->FREEZE = LETIMER_FREEZE_REGFREEZE;
00291   }
00292   else
00293   {
00294     letimer->FREEZE = 0;
00295   }
00296 }
00297 #endif /* defined(_LETIMER_FREEZE_MASK) */
00298 
00299 /***************************************************************************/
00323 void LETIMER_Init(LETIMER_TypeDef *letimer, const LETIMER_Init_TypeDef *init)
00324 {
00325   uint32_t tmp = 0;
00326 
00327   EFM_ASSERT(LETIMER_REF_VALID(letimer));
00328 
00329   /* Stop timer if specified to be disabled and running */
00330   if (!(init->enable) && (letimer->STATUS & LETIMER_STATUS_RUNNING))
00331   {
00332 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00333     /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00334     regSync(letimer, LETIMER_SYNCBUSY_CMD);
00335 #endif
00336     letimer->CMD = LETIMER_CMD_STOP;
00337   }
00338 
00339   /* Configure DEBUGRUN flag, sets whether or not counter should be
00340    * updated when debugger is active */
00341   if (init->debugRun)
00342   {
00343     tmp |= LETIMER_CTRL_DEBUGRUN;
00344   }
00345 
00346 #if defined(LETIMER_CTRL_RTCC0TEN)
00347   if (init->rtcComp0Enable)
00348   {
00349     tmp |= LETIMER_CTRL_RTCC0TEN;
00350   }
00351 
00352   if (init->rtcComp1Enable)
00353   {
00354     tmp |= LETIMER_CTRL_RTCC1TEN;
00355   }
00356 #endif
00357 
00358   if (init->comp0Top)
00359   {
00360     tmp |= LETIMER_CTRL_COMP0TOP;
00361   }
00362 
00363   if (init->bufTop)
00364   {
00365     tmp |= LETIMER_CTRL_BUFTOP;
00366   }
00367 
00368   if (init->out0Pol)
00369   {
00370     tmp |= LETIMER_CTRL_OPOL0;
00371   }
00372 
00373   if (init->out1Pol)
00374   {
00375     tmp |= LETIMER_CTRL_OPOL1;
00376   }
00377 
00378   tmp |= init->ufoa0 << _LETIMER_CTRL_UFOA0_SHIFT;
00379   tmp |= init->ufoa1 << _LETIMER_CTRL_UFOA1_SHIFT;
00380   tmp |= init->repMode << _LETIMER_CTRL_REPMODE_SHIFT;
00381 
00382 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00383   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00384   regSync(letimer, LETIMER_SYNCBUSY_CTRL);
00385 #endif
00386   letimer->CTRL = tmp;
00387 
00388   /* Start timer if specified to be enabled and not already running */
00389   if (init->enable && !(letimer->STATUS & LETIMER_STATUS_RUNNING))
00390   {
00391 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00392     /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00393     regSync(letimer, LETIMER_SYNCBUSY_CMD);
00394 #endif
00395     letimer->CMD = LETIMER_CMD_START;
00396   }
00397 }

00400 /***************************************************************************/
00413 uint32_t LETIMER_RepeatGet(LETIMER_TypeDef *letimer, unsigned int rep)
00414 {
00415   uint32_t ret;
00416 
00417   EFM_ASSERT(LETIMER_REF_VALID(letimer) && LETIMER_REP_REG_VALID(rep));
00418 
00419   /* Initialize selected compare value */
00420   switch (rep)
00421   {
00422     case 0:
00423       ret = letimer->REP0;
00424       break;
00425 
00426     case 1:
00427       ret = letimer->REP1;
00428       break;
00429 
00430     default:
00431       /* Unknown compare register selected */
00432       ret = 0;
00433       break;
00434   }
00435 
00436   return(ret);
00437 }

00440 /***************************************************************************/
00460 void LETIMER_RepeatSet(LETIMER_TypeDef *letimer,
00461                        unsigned int rep,
00462                        uint32_t value)
00463 {
00464   volatile uint32_t *repReg;
00465 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00466   uint32_t          syncbusy;
00467 #endif
00468   EFM_ASSERT(LETIMER_REF_VALID(letimer)
00469              && LETIMER_REP_REG_VALID(rep)
00470              && ((value & ~(_LETIMER_REP0_REP0_MASK
00471                             >> _LETIMER_REP0_REP0_SHIFT))
00472                  == 0));
00473 
00474   /* Initialize selected compare value */
00475   switch (rep)
00476   {
00477     case 0:
00478       repReg = &(letimer->REP0);
00479 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00480       syncbusy = LETIMER_SYNCBUSY_REP0;
00481 #endif
00482       break;
00483 
00484     case 1:
00485       repReg = &(letimer->REP1);
00486 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00487       syncbusy = LETIMER_SYNCBUSY_REP1;
00488 #endif
00489       break;
00490 
00491     default:
00492       /* Unknown compare register selected, abort */
00493       return;
00494   }
00495 
00496 #if defined(_EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY)
00497   /* LF register about to be modified require sync. busy check */
00498   regSync(letimer, syncbusy);
00499 #endif
00500 
00501   *repReg = value;
00502 }

00505 /***************************************************************************/
00516 void LETIMER_Reset(LETIMER_TypeDef *letimer)
00517 {
00518 #if defined(_LETIMER_FREEZE_MASK)
00519   /* Freeze registers to avoid stalling for LF synchronization */
00520   LETIMER_FreezeEnable(letimer, true);
00521 #endif
00522 
00523   /* Make sure disabled first, before resetting other registers */
00524   letimer->CMD = LETIMER_CMD_STOP | LETIMER_CMD_CLEAR
00525                  | LETIMER_CMD_CTO0 | LETIMER_CMD_CTO1;
00526   letimer->CTRL  = _LETIMER_CTRL_RESETVALUE;
00527   letimer->COMP0 = _LETIMER_COMP0_RESETVALUE;
00528   letimer->COMP1 = _LETIMER_COMP1_RESETVALUE;
00529   letimer->REP0  = _LETIMER_REP0_RESETVALUE;
00530   letimer->REP1  = _LETIMER_REP1_RESETVALUE;
00531   letimer->IEN   = _LETIMER_IEN_RESETVALUE;
00532   letimer->IFC   = _LETIMER_IFC_MASK;
00533   /* Do not reset route register, setting should be done independently */
00534 
00535 #if defined(_LETIMER_FREEZE_MASK)
00536   /* Unfreeze registers, pass new settings on to LETIMER */
00537   LETIMER_FreezeEnable(letimer, false);
00538 #endif
00539 }
